source_sentence: 歸命瑜伽自在王　　善住如幻三昧者　普於淨染諸剎海　　能示種種隨類身　我依蓮華相應門　　開示多羅大悲法　為令修習三昧者　　離於二乘無悲定　速具神通波羅蜜　　即能頓證如來位　行者應發普賢心　　從師具受金剛戒　不顧身命起慈心　　乃能堪入解脫輪　應從師受三摩耶　　契印密語如經說　敬阿闍梨如佛想　　於同學所殷重心　或於山間阿練若　　流泉浴池悅意處　山峯石窟逈樹邊　　建立壇場如法則　莊嚴精室置本尊　　隨力供養一心住　遍觀十方諸佛海　　懺悔發願皆如教　為成三業金剛故　　當於二手舌心中　吽字想成五智杵　　猶是加持能悉地　次應結契名警覺　　二手皆作金剛拳　檀慧相鉤竪進力　　二度相拄名起印真言曰。
translation: 歸命瑜伽自在王　　善住如幻三昧者　普於淨染諸剎海　　能示種種隨類身　我依蓮華相應門　　開示多羅大悲法　為令修習三昧者　　離於二乘無悲定　速具神通波羅蜜　　即能頓證如來位　行者應發普賢心　　從師具受金剛戒　不顧身命起慈心　　乃能堪入解脫輪　應從師受三摩耶　　契印密語如經說　敬阿闍梨如佛想　　於同學所殷重心　或於山間阿練若　　流泉浴池悅意處　山峯石窟逈樹邊　　建立壇場如法則　莊嚴精室置本尊　　隨力供養一心住　遍觀十方諸佛海　　懺悔發願皆如教　為成三業金剛故　　當於二手舌心中　吽字想成五智杵　　猶是加持能悉地　次應結契名警覺　　二手皆作金剛拳　檀慧相鉤竪進力　　二度相拄名起印真言曰。

source_sentence: 唵嚩日[口*路](二合)底瑟吒(二合)　次應敬禮阿閦尊　　捨身求請不退轉　金剛合掌舒頂上　　全身著地以心禮真言曰。
translation: "Om vajr[kou*lu](er) tiṣṭa(er), next you should venerate Venerable Akṣobhya, renounce his body, seek rebellion, and vajra palms together, stretch out the top of the head, touch the whole body to the ground, and bow with the mind," he said.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩嚩怛他(引)孽多(二)布儒波薩他那夜(引)答麼(二合)南(三)涅哩夜(二合)多夜弭(四)薩嚩怛他(引)蘖多(五)嚩日囉(二合)薩怛嚩(二合六)地瑟咤(二合七)薩嚩(二合八)[牟*含](引)　次禮南方寶生尊　　捨身求請灌頂位　金剛合掌當於心　　以額著地虔誠禮真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) Sarvâstivāda (cited) Cintā (2) Puruṣaprasthānaya (cited) Dharma (2) Nan (3) Niriraya (2) Tāyamitra (4) Sarvâstivāda (cited) Tiller (5) Vajrarasthāna (2) Sarvâstivāda (2) 6) Dīṣṭha (2) 7) Sarvâstivāda (2) 8) [mu*ham] (cited) Next, I should revere the venerable Baosheng of the South who renounces his body and seeks the stage of consecration, holding his palms together over his heart, placing his forehead on the ground with his whole body and sincerely worshipping the true chant, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩嚩怛他(引)蘖多(二)布惹毘曬迦(引)耶怛麼(二合)南(三)涅哩夜(二合)多夜弭(四)薩嚩怛他蘖多(五)嚩日囉(二合)囉怛娜(二合)阿毘詵者[牟*含](引)　次禮觀自在王尊　　捨身求請三摩地　金剛合掌置頂上　　以口著地虔心請真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) Sarvâstivāda (cited) Tiller (2) Pūrvajayavijñāna (cited) Yatamā (binary) South (3) Niriraya (binary) Dayemi (4) Sarvâstivāda (cited) Tiller (5) Vajrarā (binary) Rātana (binary) Abhisaṃ [mu*hāra] (cited) Next, he paid homage to the venerable Avalokitêśvara who renounced his body and asked for the absorption stage, placing his palms together on top of his head with his mouth on the ground in reverence, and asked him to sincerely bow with his heart, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩嚩怛他(引)蘖多(二)布惹鉢囉(二合)靺[口*栗]多(二合)娜耶(引)怛摩(二合)南(三)涅哩夜(二合)多夜弭(四)薩嚩怛他蘖多(五)嚩日囉(三合)達摩(六)鉢囉(二合)靺[口*栗]多(二合)夜[牟*含](七引)　次禮不空成就尊　　捨身求請善巧智　金剛合掌安於心　　以頂著地稽首請真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) Sarvâstivāda (cited) Tiller (2) Pūrjapura (2) Mo[ku*li]tuo (2) Naya (cited) Tama (2) Naira (2) Nemi (3) Sarvâstivāda (4) Sarvâstivāda (5) Vajra (3) Dharma (6) Pura (2) Mo[ku*li]tuo (2) Naya (7 cited) Next, he paid homage to the Bhagavān, who abandoned himself to seek skillful wisdom, placed his palms together over his heart, put his head on the ground, and reverently invoked the true chant, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩嚩怛他(引)蘖多(二)布惹羯麼(上)尼阿怛摩(二合)南(三)涅哩夜(二合)多夜弭(四)薩嚩怛他(引)蘖多(五)嚩日囉(二合)羯麼句嚧[牟*含](六)　次觀諸佛遍虛空　　當結持印普禮足　禪慧檀智反相叉　　右膝著地置頂上真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) sarva-tantra (cited) tiller (2) pojakarma (above) nyatama (2) nan (3) niraya (2) tāyamitra (4) sarva-tantra (cited) tiller (5) vajra-rāja (2) karma-māja juruo [mu*hāna] (6) pervading the sky, he should wrap his seal around it, bow his feet, salute his meditation, wisdom, sandalwood, and wisdom with his right knee on the ground, and place it on his head, saying.

source_sentence: 唵嚩日囉(二合)微(入微一反)
translation: "Om vajra (b) wi (enter wi i).

source_sentence: 次以成就妙真言　　普願眾生同悉地　一切如來稱讚法　　當願加持速成就真言曰。
translation: "Next, I'll use the wonderful true saying, 'May all sentient beings attain the same level of attainment as all tathāgatas,' and I'll praise the Tathāgata for the speedy accomplishment of the true saying, 'May the support be quickly fulfilled.'

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩嚩怛他蘖多餉悉多(二)薩嚩薩怛嚩(三合)南(三)薩嚩悉馱藥(四)三鉢睍耽(五)怛他蘖多失者(引)地底瑟綻(二合)耽(六)　次當結加端身坐　　淨除三業令清淨　諸法本性清淨故　　願令自他悉無垢真言曰。
translation: Om (1) Śāṇḍataketuṣita (2) Śāṇḍatana (3) Śāṇḍatanam (3) Śāṇḍatam (4) Sambhogaketu (5) Śāṇḍataketuṣita (5) Śāṇḍataketuṣita (5) Śāṇḍatana (6) Next, when you sit with the body correctly upright, purify it by removing the three karmic activities, and purify the intrinsic nature of all dharmas, may all sentient beings and others become spotless.

source_sentence: 唵(一)娑嚩(二合)婆嚩戍馱(二)薩嚩達麼娑嚩(二合)婆嚩戌度唅　次結蓮華三昧耶　　十度相叉堅固縛　忍願竪合如蓮葉　　想身同彼多囉尊真言曰。
translation: 唵(一)娑嚩(二合)婆嚩戍馱(二)薩嚩達麼娑嚩(二合)婆嚩戌度唅　次結蓮華三昧耶　　十度相叉堅固縛　忍願竪合如蓮葉　　想身同彼多囉尊真言曰。

source_sentence: 唵(一)嚩日囉(二合二)鉢娜麼(二合三)三麼那(四)薩怛鑁(二合五)　次結極喜三昧印　　定慧二羽堅固縛　忍辱願度中交合　　檀慧禪智竪相著真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) vajra (2) pāna (2) samādhi (3) samādhi (4) satanic (2) samādhi (5), followed by the seal of ultimate bliss, the two feathers of meditation and wisdom, firm binding, and the intersections of patience, humiliation, and the vows, and the vertical attachment of wisdom, meditation, and wisdom to the true saying goes.

source_sentence: 唵(一)三麼耶縠(引二)素嚩多(三)薩怛鑁(三合四)　次當開心入佛智　　二乳加持怛囉吒　結金剛縛當心前　　三掣開心如啟扇真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) samaya gau (2) svātā (3) satanta (3 in 4), next you should awaken your mind to the Buddha's wisdom, secondly you should breast-bear the tārāṭa, and then you should wrap the vajra binding in front of your mind. Thirdly, you should activate the joyful as the opening fan," he said.

source_sentence: 唵(一)嚩日囉(二合)滿馱(二)怛囉(二合)吒(三)　次觀蓮臺阿字門　　二點莊嚴成寂智　禪智屈入金剛縛　　召字流入於心中真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) vajra (2) maṇḍala (2) tantra (2) za (3) next, contemplate the lotus-daise-a-syllable gate, the two points of adornment, the wisdom of tranquility, the wisdom of meditation, and the infusion of the word summon into the mind with the adamantine fetters," the spell goes.

source_sentence: 唵(一)嚩日囉(二合引二)吠舍惡(三)　次結密合金剛拳　　以此加持使堅固　入印進力住禪智　　故能堅持不退失真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) vajra (2) Vaiśravaṇa (3) then closes the fist of the amalgamated metal. This binding makes it strong, and it enters the seal with the power to advance and abide in meditation and wisdom so that it can persist and not falter.

source_sentence: 唵(一)嚩日囉(二合)母瑟知(二合)[牟*含]　次結蓮華摧魔印　　以此淨除諸障難　應以金剛合掌儀　　進力如牙竪禪智　內住慈心現威怒　　右旋三匝成界方真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) vajra (2) mauserchi (2) [mu*han], then form the lotus flower mudrā, which purifies and removes obstacles and hindrances with the vajra's closed palm, advancing with power like teeth, standing with meditative wisdom, abiding with kindness, and displaying wrath.

source_sentence: 唵(一)摩訶戰拏(二)尾始嚩(二合)[口*路]波尾迦吒(三)鉢娜麼(二合)能瑟吒囉(三合四)羯囉囉(五)毘灑拏(六)嚩吒怛囉(二合七)怛囉(引)娑耶(八)娑嚩(二合)[牟*含](九)鉢娜麼(二合)藥乞叉(二合)佉陀(十)地(地力反下同)　次應端身住三昧　　二羽相叉為定印　空界塵身諸佛海　　警覺令觀真實心真言曰。
translation: Om (1) Mahacana (2) Vaiśravaṇa (3) Pāṇamā (2) Nāgasena (3) Kālāra (5) Viśāṇa (6) Vaiśravaṇa (2) Tārā (2) 7) Tārā (2) Hayagrī (8) Tārā (2) [Mou*Han] (9) Pāṇamā (2) Yakṣa (2) Khadir (10) Diliputra (same as below) Next, you should end your body and abide in samādhi, while the two feathers are folded together as a meditation mudrā, and the air, realm, and dust bodies are an ocean of buddhas, and you will be alerted to make them observe the true and real mind.

source_sentence: 唵(一)質多鉢囉(二合)底(二)微鄧迦嚕弭　即觀阿字為月輪　　重以真言使明顯真言曰。
translation: 唵(一)質多鉢囉(二合)底(二)微鄧迦嚕弭　即觀阿字為月輪　　重以真言使明顯真言曰。

source_sentence: 唵冐地質多(二合)母怛波(二合)娜夜弭　自心本性清淨故　　應妙觀察金剛蓮真言曰。
translation: "Om Ābhidhicitta (btn) mudrā (btn) nayāmī, because the original nature of one's mind is pure, the adamantine lotus should be observed subtly," he said.

source_sentence: 唵底瑟吒(二合)鉢娜麼(二合)
translation: "Om tiṣṭa (sextuple) pāna-māsa (sextuple).

source_sentence: 為成清淨一相故　　漸令開敷同法界　即得大悲三摩地　　悉能普淨眾生界真言曰。
translation: "In order to achieve the single characteristic of purity, gradually make them spread out into the same realm of reality and attain the concentration of great compassion that thoroughly purifies the realm of sentient beings," he said.

source_sentence: 唵(一)薩發(二合)囉鉢娜麼(二合)　為令三昧純熟故　　悉令延縮得自在　漸歛智蓮量己身　　普發淨光照三昧真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) saṃhara (2) pāna-māsa (2) in order to make samādhi ripen, gradually cause it to contract and attain mastery, gradually reinforce the wisdom lotus, measure itself, and universally emit pure radiance to illuminate the samādhi," he said.

source_sentence: 唵(一)僧訶囉(二)鉢娜麼(二合)　次以堅固妙真言　　加持能令不傾動真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) siṃhara (2) pāna-māsa (2) followed by the subtle, firm, and true words, which uphold and keep from tilting, are these.

source_sentence: 唵(一)涅里(二合)茶(二)底瑟姹(二合三)鉢娜麼(二合)　虛空所現諸如來　　悉入覺華為一體　應知等同於諸佛　　堅固菩提誓願身真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) neri (2) cha (2) tiṣeqe (2) pana (2) tathāgatas who appear in space and who all enter the flower of enlightenment as one body should be known to be equal to the buddhas. The verbal expression for the body of the vow to firmly establish enlightenment is.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜麼(二合引)怛麼(二合)句唅(二)三麼諭唅(三)麼訶三麼諭唅(四)薩嚩怛他蘖多(引)毘三冐提(五)鉢娜麼(二合引)怛麼(二合)句唅　即觀妙蓮為本尊　　其身淨滿綠金色　摩尼妙寶為珠瓔　　寶冠首戴無量壽　右現殊勝與願印　　左以定手持青蓮　住於三昧處月輪　　普放慈光照三界　次以根本青蓮印　　心額喉頂遍加持真言曰。
translation: Om (1) Pāṇḍamā (2) Tammā (2) Kukkuṭa (2) (2) Samaśakkuṭa (3) Mahāsamakkuṭa (4) Saṃtatantra Tiller (3) Vaiśāsandi (5) Pāṇḍamā (2) Tammā (2) Kukkuṭa He observes the wonderful lotus as the original honored one, whose body is pure and full of green-golden color, and whose jeweled crown and head are adorned with the beads of immeasurable life. On the right side, he exhibits the sign of superiority and vows, while on the left side he holds the blue lotus in his hand with concentration, abiding in the moon-wheel of samādhi, he universally radiates compassionate light to illuminate the three realms.

source_sentence: 唵(一)多唎(二)咄多唎(三)吽　次結寶印自灌頂　　二羽堅固金剛縛　進力禪智如寶形　　額上加持繫頂後真言曰。
translation: "Om (a) dorī (b) dudu dorī (c) un. Next, he sets a jeweled seal to consecrate himself, firmly binds the two feathers to the vajra, advances his meditation powers and wisdom like a jewel, and binds his head with the above-mentioned invocation, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)嚩日囉(二合二)囉怛那(二合引三)毘詵者[牟*含](四)薩嚩畝捺囉(二合)迷(五)涅哩(二合)值句嚧(六)嚩囉迦嚩制(七)娜[牟*含]　二手如垂鬘帶已　　便應自被堅固甲　結金剛拳舒進力　　唵砧二字想指面　心背臍腰及兩膝　　喉額頂後皆三遶　檀慧前散垂天衣　　即能堅固無傾動　當以二羽三相拍　　是名蓮華喜印儀真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) Vajra (2) Rātana (2) Vaiśeṣika [mu*hān] (4) Sāva (2) Aumu (2) Mīra (5) Neri (2) Jigulo (6) Vajra (2) Vajrasena (7) Nāgasena (2) Secondly, after carrying the garland, he should then put on his own armor that's strong, bind the adamantine fists, stretch out the advancing power, think of the two letters Om (2), Aṅgasena (2), the back of the heart, the navel, the waist, the two knees, the throat, the top of the head, and the back of the three rings, and scatter the draped heavenly garments in front of the donor's wisdom that are strong and unshaken.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜麼(二合二)都使也(二合)縠(引)　次應嚴淨佛國土　　為欲奉事諸如來　諦觀無盡香水海　　妙蓮上持華藏界　摩尼寶殿以莊嚴　　出過諸天妙供具　虛空諸天為第五　　所欲皆從虛空生　心樂供養諸聖眾　　願令如意普圓滿　以此真實加持已　　當結金剛合掌儀真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) padana-māsa (2) tuṣita (2) gau (citation needed) Next, you should adorn the Buddha's land in order to serve the Tathāgatas, truly observe the endless ocean of perfume, the wonderful lotus that rises above the lotus treasury, the jeweled maṇi hall that adorns it, the marvelous offerings that transcend the gods, the heavens in space that are the fifth, the desires that arise from space, the hearts that delight in making offerings to the noble ones, and may they be filled with wishes. After this true empowerment, you should wrap your palms together in the ritual spell of the vajra, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)誐誐娜(二)三婆嚩(三)嚩日囉(二合)縠(引)　寶地莊嚴華座上　　咄弄(二合)字門成本尊　放淨光明超日月　　蓮華眷屬悉圍遶　次以請召密方便　　召集尊身入智體　定慧二羽堅固縛　　進力二度屈出鉤真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) ga ga na (2) sambhava (3) vajra gauze (citation needed) on the jeweled-landscape flower throne, the honored one who radiates pure light that transcends the sun and moon and is surrounded by the lotus family, then summons the honored one's body into the body of wisdom with the two feathers of concentration and wisdom firmly bound, advancing with power to bend and hook twice," he said.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜忙(二合)俱舍(引)迦哩灑(二合)耶(二)摩訶鉢娜麼(二合三)俱蘭訶也仡唎(二合)嚩(四)三麼焰吽(五)弱　次結蓮華索大印　　蓮掌智入進禪中　以此密印及真言　　召請本尊能引入真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) Pāṇḍamāsa (2) Kālīśāya (2) Mahāprajñāma (2) Kulanhaya Gelāgata (2) Va (4) Samyang Un (5) Weak. Next, he forms the great seal of the lotus cord, and the wisdom of the lotus palm enters his meditation. With this esoteric seal and true words, he summons the Bhagavān to bring him in.

source_sentence: 唵(一)阿目伽播捨(二)句嚧馱(三)三摩曳(四)鉢囉(二合下同)吠舍(五)鉢囉(二合)吠捨耶(六)薩嚩三麼延吽　次結華手為鎖印　　進力禪智相鉤結　以此蓮華止留印　　能令本尊堅固住真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) amogha-pāśa (2) kulodhar (3) samaye (4) pala (2) vaiśya (5) pala (2) vaiśya (6) sarva-samayan un The next seal is the seal of the lotus hand as a lock The wisdom of advancing into meditation is linked with the power of the lotus to stop and keep the Bhagavān firmly in place.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜麼(二合)商迦犁[牟*含]　次結蓮華鈴密印　　禪智屈入蓮華掌　以此密印及真言　　能令本尊妙歡喜真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) pāna-māsa (2) shōgāli [mu*han], then he forms the lotus-bell mudrā, bends his meditation and wisdom into the lotus palm, and with this mudrā and dhāraṇī he causes the Bhagavān to rejoice splendidly.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜麼(二合)健吒(二)馱哩(三)施伽囉(二合)摩(四)吠舍耶(六)三麼耶(七)殺目佉(八)惡　次以悅意妙伽陀　　捧持閼伽獻香水　妙音遍至無邊界　　以此加持速成就真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) Pāna-māsa (2) Kāṇḍa (2) Dāri (3) Śigara (2) Mo (4) Vaiśeya (6) Samahya (7) Śamukha (8) Nāgārjuna (8) Subsequently, with the wonderful intention of Gadha, he holds his gandharva and offers it as perfume. The wonderful sound reaches the infinite realm. The true saying is, 'The speedy accomplishment of this invocation'.

source_sentence: 娜莫曳娜薩帝娜(一)婆誐嚩底(二)冐地母陀囉(三)努多囉(四)嚩日囉(二合)達摩(五)鉢囉(二合)諭儗娜(六)諦娜薩諦娜(七)悉[亭*夜][牟*含](八)唵(九)多利(十)咄多唎(十一)咄唎(十二)薩嚩(二合)訶(引)　次應廣設四內供　　華掌竪建禪智度　以此蓮華嬉戲故　　能滿檀那波羅蜜真言曰。
translation: "Namojina satina (1) bhagavatī (2) ayudhimudrā (3) nudrā (4) vajradhāra (2) dharma (5) pala (2) oksana (6) dina satina (7) siddha [ting*yai][mu*han] (8) oṃ (9) doli (10) duduolli (11) duolli (12) sarva (2) ha (citation needed) Next, you should create four internal offerings, place your palms together, and build a meditation and wisdom altar because this lotus plays, which can fill the dāna-pāramitā," he said.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜麼(二合)囉底(二)布而曳(二合下同)縠　次結蓮華鬘密印　　以蓮華掌前申臂　由獻華鬘供養故　　當滿淨戒波羅蜜真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) pana-māsa (2) rādi (2) po-hi-rādi (2) gau Next, set up a lotus garland mudrā Using the lotus's palm to extend its arm Because of the offerings made with the lotus garland, you should complete the perfection of pure morality," he said.

source_sentence: 唵鉢娜麼(二合)苾曬迦(二)布而曳(二合)囉吒　次結蓮華歌詠印　　華掌從臍至口散　獻此如來妙法音　　能滿安忍波羅蜜真言曰。
translation: "Om pāna-māsa (btn.) pūrva-rāja (btn.) rāṣṭrapāla. Next, set the seal of the lotus flower song, spread the lotus palm from the navel to the mouth, and offer this wonderful Dharma voice of the Tathāgata that will fulfill the perfection of patience, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜麼(二合二)儗多布而曳(二合三)儗　次結蓮華舞供養　　華手旋舞置於頂　由此密印及真言　　速具精進波羅蜜真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) pāna-māsa (2) Śubhupuṣṭah (2) Śubhupuṣṭah (2) Next, he forms the lotus flower dance offering, twirls his hands in the air, and places them on top of his head. This is the secret seal and the true saying, which quickly completes the perfection of effort," he says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜麼(二合二)涅哩(二合)底也(二合)布而曳(二合)訖哩(二合)吒　次結蓮華焚香印　　華掌下散如焚香　由此梵香印威力　　當證靜慮波羅蜜真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) pāna-māsa (2) nirṛ (2) tiya (2) puṇḍarī (2) kṛ (2) za Next, he forms the lotus flower incense burning mudrā, and he spreads it like burning incense under his palms. The power of this brahma incense mudrā is realized," he says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)度波鉢娜弭(二合)儞(二)吽　次結蓮華華供養　　蓮掌上散如獻華　由獻妙華莊嚴故　　速證般若波羅蜜真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) dubhapanama (2) an (2) un (2) un Next, he forms a lotus-flower offering, scattering flowers like offerings on the lotus's palm. Because of the offerings of the marvelous flowers, he quickly realizes the perfection of wisdom, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜麼(二合二)母瑟知(二合三)吽　次結蓮華燈明印　　禪智前逼蓮華手　以此燈明供養故　　當滿方便波羅蜜真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) pāna-māsa (2) mārsa-know (2) un Next, he forms the sign for the lotus flower's lamp, forcing the lotus hand in front of his meditation consciousness to make offerings because of this lamp. The perfection of skillful means is explained in the following verbal formula.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜麼(二合二)句囉(三)遜捺唎(四)達摩(引)嚕計(五)布而曳(三合六)布惹耶(七)吽　次結蓮華塗香印　　散掌心上如塗香　以此真言密印儀　　能滿誓願波羅蜜真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) pāna-māsa (2) kulā (3) sundāra (4) dharma (citation) rudraka (5) pojayī (3) pojaya (7) un The second seal is the lotus flower incense mudrā, which is applied like incense to the palm of the hand and sealed with the esoteric ritual of this true teaching.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜麼(二合二)巘提(三)吽　次結本尊根本印　　以印加持自心上　二羽智拳節相背　　進力禪智竪相合真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) pāna-māsa (2) peak ti (3) un Next, he makes the fundamental mudrā of the venerable, applying it to his own mind, placing the two feathers of wisdom on his fists with the knuckles facing each other, advancing the powers of meditation and wisdom, and then putting them together," he says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜麼(二合二)多黎(三)吽　次結不空多羅心　　以印加持於額上　準前根本祕印相　　改竪檀慧令相著真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) pāna-māsa (2) ruta (3) un. Next, he forms the fakṣa-tārāsin, applies his seal to his forehead, and conforms to the previous fundamental and esoteric seal patterns. He modifies the vertical wisdom of the donor so that it adheres to each other, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)尾補囉(二)多黎(三)吽　次結本尊寶冠印　　以此大印置頂上　準前心印竪忍願　　進力遠屈二度背真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) udumbara (2) ruta (3) un. Next, he sets the seal of the jeweled crown of the Bhagavān and places this large seal on his forehead, in keeping with the preceding seal of the mind, raising the vow for forbearance, advancing his powers, and bending his back two times, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢囉(二合)嚩囉(二)多黎(三)吽　次結真實加持印　　以此能召於一切　準前灌頂寶冠印　　唯以精進度去來真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) pala (2) vajra (2) ruta (3) un. Next, he sets the seal of true empowerment, which summons all [sentient beings], in accord with the preceding consecration seal of the jeweled crown, and only progresses and comes with energy," he says.

source_sentence: 唵(一)阿慕伽(二)多[口*梨](三)吽　次結摧壞諸魔印　　以此能伏難調者　準前灌頂寶冠印　　直申力度右旋遶真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) amogha (2) tuo [ku*ri] (3) un Subsequent to the sign of destroying demons, which is capable of subduing those who are difficult to control, he directly explains the strength of his efforts by circling to the right, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)三麼耶(二)多[口*梨](三)吽　次以字門布己身　　唵字頂上哆安額　[口*梨]字兩目咄二肩　　哆字當心[口*梨]當臍　咄字二膝[口*梨]二脛　　薩嚩(二合)左足訶右足　四明引尊入己身　　以此加持無二體　應結青蓮根本印　　稱誦蓮華百字明　定慧二羽內相叉　　進力禪智竪相拄真言曰。
translation: "Om (a) samaya (b) tuo [mou*ri] (c) un Next, spread out your body with the word 'gate,' the top of the letter om, the amount of do [mou*ri], the two eyes of the word du, the two shoulders of the word du, the heart of the word du, the navel of the word du, the two knees of the word du, and the two shins of the word sarva (binary), the left foot, the right foot of the word ha, and the four luminous guides for the honored one to enter your body. With this blessing, there are no two bodies.

source_sentence: 唵(一)鉢娜麼(二合下同)薩怛嚩(二合下同)三麼耶(二)麼弩播羅耶(三)鉢娜麼(二合)薩怛嚩(二合四)怛尾弩波底瑟吒(二合五)涅哩(二合)拏護(二合)寐婆嚩(六)素覩使諭(二合)寐婆嚩(七)阿弩囉訖覩(二合)寐婆嚩(八)素補使諭(二合)寐婆嚩(九)薩嚩悉地寐鉢囉(二合)也瑳(十)薩嚩羯麼素者寐(十一)質多室[口*梨](二合)藥(十二)句路吽(十三)呵呵呵呵縠(引十四)薄伽梵(十五)薩嚩怛他蘖多(十六)鉢娜麼(十七)麼寐悶者(十八)鉢娜寐(引)婆嚩(十九)摩訶三麼耶薩怛嚩(二十)紇唎(二合引聲)　稱誦百字真言已　　不解前印念本明真言曰。
translation: Om (1) Pāṇamā (2) Same as below.

source_sentence: 娜謨囉(一)怛那(二合)怛囉(二合)夜(引)也(二)娜莫阿哩也(二合三)嚩魯枳帝(四)濕嚩(二合)囉耶(五)冒地薩怛嚩(二合)耶(六)摩訶薩怛嚩(二合)耶(七)摩訶迦嚕抳迦耶(八)怛儞也(二合)他(九)唵(十)哆[口*梨](十一)咄多[口*梨](十二)咄[口*梨](十三)薩嚩(二合)訶(引)　復以真言加珠鬘　　頂上捧戴當心念真言曰。
translation: "Nāmurā (1) Tāna (2) Tārā (2) Yajñadatta (2) (2) Nāmurā (2) Ariyā (2) (3) Varuṇa (4) Śiva (2) Rāja (5) Boddhi (2) Sattva (2) Yajñadatta (6) Mahāsattva (2) Yajñadatta (7) Mahākātyāyana (8) Tānaya (2) Tathāgata (9) Om (10) Do [mouth * pear] (11) Dudu [mouth * pear] (12) Dudu [mouth * pear] (13) Sarvâstivāda (2) Ha (citation needed) Again, add a garland of beads with the true chant, hold it over your head, and recite the true chant mentally, saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)嚩日囉(二合)跛尾怛囉(二合)三麼耶吽　誦持數限終竟已　　復獻閼伽誦妙讚　重設八供發願已　　解界想尊還本宮　結前蓮華三昧耶　　頂上散華便禮足真言曰。
translation: "Om (1) vajra (2) limo tantra (2) samaya un After reciting it for a limited number of times, he then offered his guardian armor, recited the wonderful hymn of praise, reset the eight offerings, and vowed to return the honored one to his home palace after concluding the lotus flower samaya, scattered the flowers on top of his head, and then saluted his feet with the true saying.

source_sentence: 唵(一)訖哩妬嚩(二入)薩嚩薩怛嚩(二合)[口*栗]託(三)悉地捺多(四)也他弩誐(五)蘖[土*差]特鑁(六)沒馱微灑焰(七)布那囉誐(八)麼那也都(九)唵(十)鉢那麼(二合十一)薩怛嚩(二合十二)穆　以奉送諸本尊已　　加持灌頂被甲冑　堅住本尊三摩地　　自恣住止或經行　復應轉讀摩訶衍　　常令淨業恒不間　當得多羅親現前　　所求勝願皆圓滿　現世得入歡喜地　　十六生後成菩提金剛頂經多羅菩薩念誦法一卷
translation: "Om (1) Kṛṣṇu (2) Sātavasatha (2) [Mouth*Little] Tantra (3) Siddhârtha (4) Yathānugata (5) Tiller [Tu*cha] Tejaprabhā (6) Bhūtamatha (7) Pūrṇaratha (8) Māṇayathu (9) Om (10) Nanamatha (2) Eleven) Sātavasatha (2) Twelve) Mu After presenting these honored ones with the consecration, he should firmly maintain the honored one's samādhi, perform the consecration, wear armor, firmly maintain the homogenous samādhi, freely abide, stop, or practice the scriptures, and then read the Book of Mahāyāna so that his pure activities will continue uninterruptedly. He will attain the personal appearance of Tārā, and all his sought-after excellent vows will be fulfilled.
